channel.title: RuneTek 1
channel.description: Where can I find an archive of games based off RT1?

item.title: RuneTek 1
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I’m not sure that games like Vertigo and his Endless black hole app were built on the rt1 engine, I’m sure they were just standalone projects he made while working with Java? Also, you used to be able to play a few of the original games on archive.org. If you can’t, I’m sure you can find them on google

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

There were games like Vertigo and yes, there were other games other than DeviousMUD.

I’ve seen someone post a download archive of RT1 games for. Can anyone repost it?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTek 1
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

History
1998-2000: RuneTek 1 - Games Domain; DeviousMUD
2000-2003: RuneTek 2 - RuneScape Classic
2003-2007: RuneTek 3 - RuneScape 2
2007-2009: RuneTek 4 - RuneScape High Detail
2009-2010: RuneTek 5 - Cross-platform version that runs both SD and HD on the same engine.

Were there any games other than DeviousMUD? From what I understand, Gower totally redid runetek 1 after he ditched DeviousMUD.

Jagex Wiki

Games Domain

Games Domain was a site for which Jagex worked for a long time before they made their own games sites. The games made by Jagex were Battle Cruisers, Cyber Wars, Dungeon Explorer, Games Domain Castle, Mahjong, Quad-Link, Mystery Monster, Pairs and...


http://web.archive.org/web/20020120151123/http://jagex.com/
http://web.archive.org/web/19991128065926/jagex.com/games.html

Read full topic
